name: Titanium.Network.HTTPClient
summary: HTTP client object that (mostly) implements the XMLHttpRequest specification.

methods.name: clearCookies
methods.summary: Clears any cookies stored for the host.

parameters.name: host
parameters.summary: The URL of the host/domain to clear cookies for.

methods.name: getResponseHeader
methods.summary: Returns the value of the specified response header.

parameters.name: name
parameters.summary: Name of the header to retrieve.

methods.name: open
methods.summary: Opens the request and prepares the connection.

parameters.name: method
parameters.summary: HTTP method for this request, such as 'GET' or 'POST'. 'PATCH' is available on Android from SDK 4.1.0.

parameters.name: async
parameters.summary: Determines whether the request should be made asynchronously. Only used on iOS.

methods.name: send
methods.description:
For POST requests, use the data parameter to send POST data.

If you pass a serializable JavaScript object, it is automatically turned into form-encoded POST data. You can also send an arbitrary string or binary data (in the form of a Titanium.Blob).

To send array data, specify each array element individually as a property of the object. For example, normally, you specify an array in an object as:

var payload = { myArray: [1, 2, 3] };

Instead, for the HTTP client to encode the data correctly, you need to send the data as:

var payload = {
    "myArray[0]" : 1,
    "myArray[1]" : 2,
    "myArray[2]" : 3
};

On iOS, you can specify a synchronous request when you call open by passing false for the async parameter. In the case of a synchronous request, send blocks until the request is complete.

parameters.name: data
parameters.summary: Data to send with a POST request.

methods.name: setRequestHeader
methods.summary: Sets the value for the specified request header. Must be called after open but before send.

parameters.name: name
parameters.summary: Name of the header to set.

parameters.name: value
parameters.summary:
Value to assign to the header. May be `null` to clear a default header value, such as
X-Requested-With.

properties.name: securityManager
properties.summary: All of the response headers.
properties.description:
Contains a single string, or an empty string if no headers are available.

See also: getResponseHeader.

properties.name: autoEncodeUrl
properties.summary: Determines whether automatic encoding is enabled for the specified URL.
properties.description: Set to false to disable automatic URL-encoding.

properties.name: autoRedirect
properties.summary: Determines whether automatic automatic handling of HTTP redirects is enabled.
properties.description: Set to false to disable automatic HTTP redirects handling.

properties.name: cache
properties.summary: Determines whether HTTP responses are cached.
properties.description:
If cache is set to true, requests using this HTTP client will cache their responses (respecting headers such as "no-cache", "no-store", and cache expiry). In this case, repeated requests to the same URL may retrieve the initial response rather than triggering a new request. The cache is shared between all instances of HTTPClient.

Caching should only be enabled for HTTP requests which you expect the result to remain consistent for.

If cache is false, any request on this HTTP client will result in a new HTTP request.

This propery must be set before open is called.

properties.name: connected
properties.summary: Indicates whether the response was successful.

properties.name: connectionType
properties.summary: Connection type, normally either GET, POST or PATCH.

properties.name: domain
properties.summary: Sets the domain parameter for authentication credentials.
properties.description: Set this parameter when authentication against NTLM domains along with the username and password properties. iOS supports NTLM authentication natively. Android can be extended using the addAuthFactory method. Must be set before calling open.

properties.name: enableKeepAlive
properties.summary: Determines whether the client should attempt to keep a persistent connection.
properties.description: Set to true to maintain a persistent connection.

properties.name: file
properties.summary: Target local file to receive data.
properties.description:
On iOS, can only be set after calling open.

On Android, can be set anytime prior to calling send. The file must be writable such as the application data directory or temp directory.

properties.name: location
properties.summary: Absolute URL of the request.
properties.description: If the request redirects, this property returns the URL of the redirected request.

properties.name: ondatastream
properties.summary: Function to be called at regular intervals as the request data is being received.
properties.description:
Must be set before calling open.

The progress property of the event will contain a value from 0.0-1.0 with the progress of the request. On iOS and Android as of 3.5.0, if the progress can not be calculated, the value will be PROGRESS_UNKNOWN.

properties.name: onerror
properties.summary: Function to be called upon a error response.
properties.description:
Must be set before calling open.

The callback's argument is an object with a single property, error, containing the error string.

properties.name: onload
properties.summary: Function to be called upon a successful response.
properties.description:
Must be set before calling open.

To access response data and headers, access the HTTPClient object itself (accessible as this during the callback, or the source property of the callback event).

properties.name: onreadystatechange
properties.summary: Function to be called for each readyState change.
properties.description:
Must be set before calling open.

When the callback is invoked, this.readyState is set to one of the Titanium.Network.HTTPClient ready-state constants, OPENED, HEADERS_RECEIVED, LOADING, or DONE.

Due to the asynchronous nature of the Titanium platform, the internal value of readyState might be different from the state change for which the event was fired. To address this discrepancy, the function is now invoked with a payload object of type ReadyStatePayload. This was introduced in version 3.4.2 of the SDK and is supported on the iOS and android platforms.

properties.name: onsendstream
properties.summary: Function to be called at regular intervals as the request data is being transmitted.
properties.description:
Must be set before calling open.

The progress property of the event will contain a value from 0.0-1.0 with the progress of the upload.

properties.name: password
properties.summary: Sets the password parameter for authentication credentials.
properties.description: Must be set before calling open.

properties.name: readyState
properties.summary: The current ready state of this HTTP request.
properties.description:
The ready state describes the current state of the request. The ready state is set to one of the five Titanium.Network.HTTPClient ready state constants. A typical HTTP request goes through the states in this order:

  • UNSENT
  • OPENED
  • HEADERS_RECEIVED
  • LOADING
  • DONE

The onreadystatechange callback is invoked each time the ready state changes.

properties.name: responseData
properties.summary: Response data as a Blob object.

properties.name: responseHeaders
properties.summary: Returns all the response headers returned with the request.
properties.description:
Contains a dictionary of response headers only after the http call has finished.

See also: getResponseHeader.

properties.name: responseText
properties.summary: Response as text.
properties.description: Set to null if an error was received or no data was returned.

properties.name: responseXML
properties.summary: Response object as an XML DOM Document object.
properties.description: Set to null if the content type returned by the server was not XML or if the content could not be parsed.

properties.name: securityManager
properties.summary: The Security Manager for this client.
properties.description: This property must be specified during creation. Set this property on the HTTPClient to participate in the authentication and resource management of the connection. See SecurityManagerProtocol for further information.

properties.name: status
properties.summary: Response HTTP status code.

properties.name: statusText
properties.summary: Human-readable status message associated with the status code.

properties.name: timeout
properties.summary: Timeout in milliseconds when the connection should be aborted.

properties.name: tlsVersion
properties.summary: Sets the TLS version to use for handshakes.
properties.description:
If you experience handshake failures, set this value to a lower version using the TLS constants in Titanium.Network. 'undefined', 'null', or unsupported values use the default behavior for that iOS and Android versions.

Setting this property disables falling back to lower TLS versions.

properties.name: username
properties.summary: Sets the username parameter for authentication credentials.
properties.description: Must be set before calling open.

properties.name: validatesSecureCertificate
properties.summary: Determines how SSL certification validation is performed on connection.
properties.description: On Android, this property is ignored if the addKeyManager or addTrustManager methods are used to create a custom SSL context.
properties.default:
False when running in the simulator or on device in testing mode, and true if built for
release in distribution mode.

constants.name: DONE
constants.summary: Ready state constant indicating that the request is complete.
constants.description:
In this ready state, either the data has been transferred, or an error has occured.

See also readyState.

constants.name: HEADERS_RECEIVED
constants.summary: Ready state constant indicating that response headers have been received.

constants.name: LOADING
constants.summary: Ready state constant indicating that response data is being received from the remote server.

constants.name: OPENED
constants.summary: Ready state constant indicating that the connection has been opened, but the request has not yet been sent.

constants.name: UNSENT
constants.summary: Ready state constant indicating that HTTPClient request has not been opened or sent.
